David Cameron is said to be so worried about the prospect of losing legislation in a parliamentary logjam that he held a series of meetings with MPs and peers last week described as a "charm offensive" . The Prime Minister is definitely in listening mode as never before, said one Conservative MP. "He is much more conciliatory, the mood music has completely changed." It is understood Mr Andy Coulson first informed the Prime Minister of his intention to leave last Wednesday before

" Andy Coulson has been very clear that he was not in any way responsible for phone hacking and had no knowledge of it. I have no reason to disbelieve him.
